data.event: Its population as of the 2010 Census was 2,429, of which 1,972 resided in Belushya Guba, an urban-type settlement that is the administrative center of Novaya Zemlya District.

The indigenous population (from 1872 to the 1950s when it was resettled to the mainland) consisted of about 50â€“300 Nenetses who subsisted mainly on fishing, trapping, reindeer herding, polar bear hunting and seal hunting.

event.title: is located on the Northern island and is 1547

data.event: The highest mountain is located on the Northern island and is 1547 meters (5075 ft) high.
